docs.snippet: ALTHOUGH we both agree that the best way to travel is by air, when our plane landed in New York this past month my husband and I heaved a sigh of relief. This was our 102nd flight in ten months of traveling -- around the world, around Africa and...
docs.lead_paragraph: ALTHOUGH we both agree that the best way to travel is by air, when our plane landed in New York this past month my husband and I heaved a sigh of relief. This was our 102nd flight in ten months of traveling -- around the world, around Africa and around South America.

headline.main: AROUND THE WORLD BY AIR IN ABOUT 300 DAYS

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., April 29 -- Twelve out of twenty Latin American Republics showed trade deficits in 1958, the Economic Commission for Latin America reported today in its annual survey of economic conditions. Others achieved a balance of...
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., April 29 -- Twelve out of twenty Latin American Republics showed trade deficits in 1958, the Economic Commission for Latin America reported today in its annual survey of economic conditions. Others achieved a balance of payments only by cutting imports drastically.
docs.abstract: ECLA repts 12 of 20 nations showed deficit in '58; total exports down $700 million; other data

headline.main: TRADE GAP WIDENS IN LATIN AMERICA; Unfavorable Balance Found by U. N. Economists for 12 of 20 Republics

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, May 2 -- Premier Fidel Castro of Cuba proposed today that the United States provide $30,000,000,000 in public capital over the next ten years to make Latin America safe for democracy.
